content.description: A somewhat dirty handcrack roof leads into a sweet 50+ degree overhanging finger crack/stem problem. This thing will be classic after it sees more ascents!
content.location: It is all the way up the hill to the right (south) of the main walls.

content.description: Climb a right-angling crack, then go straight up negotiating a thin spot before climbing the featured face above.
content.protection: Pro to 1", 4 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the left side of the crag.

content.description: Climb flakes and cracks up to bolts on the slab.
content.protection: Pro to 3”, 2 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the left side of the crag.

content.description: Mantel up to a dike and climb the black features above. The anchor is set back on the large ledge and is not visible.
content.location: It is on the right side of the crag.

climbs.name: Big Velvet
climbs.fa: Greg Miller, Scott Curtis, 3/21; Pitch 2: Greg Miller, rope solo 4/21

content.description:
Pitch 1: Clip a bolt, and make thin traversing moves. Once at the jug, go straight up on hard-to-see holds and gear placements. Traverse up a low angle corner to blocky terrain and the main ledge. The anchor is set back on the large ledge and is not visible.

Pitch 2: Climb the corner above the belay to another set of anchors.
content.protection:
Pitch 1: Pro to 2", 1 bolt/2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 2: Pro to 5”/2 bolt anchor
content.location: It is on the right side of the crag.

content.description:
Clip the first bolt on "

Let it Burn

," and climb the crack to crux at a fixed wire.
content.protection: Pro to 3", 1 bolt, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the left side of the crag.
